parts.text:
Hi! I'm your Cyoda Setup Assistant.

You can manage setup either from the Canvas (local) or Cloud panels ‚Äî I can guide you through both.

Please choose an option from the menu.

args.question: How can I help you get started?

options.label: üåê Check Environment Status
options.description: Verify if your Cyoda cloud is ready

options.label: üöÄ Local Setup Guide
options.description: Step-by-step commands to run your app

parts.text:
Great ‚Äî I‚Äôll show the local setup steps. Are you building a Python app (Path B) or a Java app (Path A)? 

- If Python, I‚Äôll show the exact Python commands to run locally.
- If Java, I‚Äôll show the Java/Gradle commands and notes.

Which one should I display?

Here are the local setup steps for a Python app (Path B). Run these in your project root.

1) Init environment file
mv .env.template .env

2) Create & activate virtual environment
python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate

3) Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

4) Run the app (default port 8000)
python app.py

5) Import Cyoda repository initialization
python common/repository/cyoda/cyoda_init.py

Do you want troubleshooting tips (virtualenv on Windows, common errors) or help with anything else?
üöÄ Local Setup Guide for python app

Hi ‚Äî I'm your Cyoda Setup Assistant. You can use the Canvas (local) and Cloud panels to manage workflows and deployments.

Here are the Python (Path B) local setup commands:

1) Init
mv .env.template .env

2) Create & activate virtualenv
python3 -m venv .venv && source .venv/bin/activate

3) Install dependencies
pip install -r requirements.txt

4) Run the app
python app.py
(Default port: 8000)

5) Import Cyoda repo utilities
python common/repository/cyoda/cyoda_init.py

Need anything else ‚Äî e.g., check environment status, generate credentials, or generate resources? If so, tell me which and I‚Äôll hand it off to the right agent.
